name: Distance Desire
description: Emotional and sensual prompts focused on longing, anticipation, reminiscing, and planning future dates. Perfect for long-distance couples who want to deepen their connection without being explicit.

prompts.text: What's something about being far from your partner that has actually brought you closer?
Send your partner a video message describing the first thing you want to do together when you're reunited.
What moment with your partner do you replay in your head when you miss them most?
Plan a future date together over video call: describe in detail what you both want it to be like.
Tell your partner about a small moment with them you wish you could experience again right now.
Write a love note to your partner and read it aloud during a video call.
What's something your partner does that makes you feel more connected even when you're apart?
Send a voice message describing exactly what your partner smells like and what memories that brings up.
What physical feature of your partner do you think about most often?
Create a playlist togetherâ€”each song should represent a moment or feeling between you two.
What's the most romantic gesture your partner has ever made for you?
Send a photo of something that reminds you of your partner and explain why.
Describe how you felt the first time you knew your partner was special.
Record a voice message: describe five reasons why you're grateful for your partner.
What's something your partner has done that made you feel deeply loved and understood?
Plan your next trip together, discussing every detail from what you'll wear to where you'll go.
What's your favorite inside joke or memory that's uniquely yours?
Create a vision board or mood board together over video call about your future together.
Describe a quiet moment with your partner that meant more than any big romantic gesture.
Send your partner a voice message singing (or speaking) a portion of your song or a love song to them.
What quality of your partner has grown more attractive to you over time?
Write down three things you want to do with your partner and share them on a video call.
What's something about your partner's personality that makes you feel safe and loved?
Create a 'when we're together' bucket list by texting ideas back and forth.
What moment with your partner made you realize this relationship was different from the others?
Describe the feeling you get when your partner sends you a surprise message or call.
Send a selfie looking your best and tell your partner why you wanted them to see you like this.
What's the best compliment your partner has ever given you?
Write a poem (serious or silly) about your partner and read it to them over voice or video.
How do you feel knowing your partner is thinking of you right now?
